text: ਤੰਤ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਸਭ ਅਉਖਧ ਜਾਨਹਿ ਅੰਤਿ ਤਊ ਮਰਨਾ ॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: those who know Tantras and mantras and all medicines - even they shall die in the end. ||2||

transliteration.text: tant mantr sabh aukhadh jānah ant taū maranā .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਰਾਜ ਭੋਗ ਅਰੁ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਸਿੰਘਾਸਨ ਬਹੁ ਸੁੰਦਰਿ ਰਮਨਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Those who enjoy regal power and rule, royal canopies and thrones, many beautiful women,

transliteration.text: rāj bhōg ar shatr singhāsan bah sundar ramanā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਪਾਨ ਕਪੂਰ ਸੁਬਾਸਕ ਚੰਦਨ ਅੰਤਿ ਤਊ ਮਰਨਾ ॥੩॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: betel nuts, camphor and fragrant sandalwood oil - in the end, they too shall die. ||3||

transliteration.text: pān kapūr subāsak chandan ant taū maranā .3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਬੇਦ ਪੁਰਾਨ ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਿ ਸਭ ਖੋਜੇ ਕਹੂ ਨ ਊਬਰਨਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I have searched all the Vedas, Puraanas and Simritees, but none of these can save anyone.

transliteration.text: bēd purān sinmrit sabh khōjē kahū n ūbaranā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਇਉ ਰਾਮਹਿ ਜੰਪਉ ਮੇਟਿ ਜਨਮ ਮਰਨਾ ॥੪॥੫॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, meditate on the Lord, and eliminate birth and death. ||4||5||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr iu rāmah janpau mēt janam maranā .4.5.

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Aasaa:

transliteration.text: āsā .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਫੀਲੁ ਰਬਾਬੀ ਬਲਦੁ ਪਖਾਵਜ ਕਊਆ ਤਾਲ ਬਜਾਵੈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The elephant is the guitar player, the ox is the drummer, and the crow plays the cymbals.

transliteration.text: phīl rabābī balad pakhāvaj kaūā tāl bajāvai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਪਹਿਰਿ ਚੋਲਨਾ ਗਦਹਾ ਨਾਚੈ ਭੈਸਾ ਭਗਤਿ ਕਰਾਵੈ ॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Putting on the skirt, the donkey dances around, and the water buffalo performs devotional worship. ||1||

transliteration.text: pahir chōlanā gadahā nāchai bhaisā bhagat karāvai .1.

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Lord, the King, has cooked the cakes of ice,

transliteration.text: rājā rām kakarīā barē pakāē .

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: but only the rare man of understanding eats them. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: kinai būjhanahārai khāē .1. rahāu .

text: ਬੈਠਿ ਸਿੰਘੁ ਘਰਿ ਪਾਨ ਲਗਾਵੈ ਘੀਸ ਗਲਉਰੇ ਲਿਆਵੈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Sitting in his den, the lion prepares the betel leaves, and the muskrat brings the betel nuts.

transliteration.text: baith singh ghar pān lagāvai ghīs galaurē liāvai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਘਰਿ ਘਰਿ ਮੁਸਰੀ ਮੰਗਲੁ ਗਾਵਹਿ ਕਛੂਆ ਸੰਖੁ ਬਜਾਵੈ ॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Going from house to house, the mouse sings the songs of joy, and the turtle blows on the conch-shell. ||2||

transliteration.text: ghar ghar musarī mangal gāvah kashūā sankh bajāvai .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਬੰਸ ਕੋ ਪੂਤੁ ਬੀਆਹਨ ਚਲਿਆ ਸੁਇਨੇ ਮੰਡਪ ਛਾਏ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The son of the sterile woman goes to get married, and the golden canopy is spread out for him.

transliteration.text: bans kō pūt bīāhan chaliā suinē mandap shāē .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਰੂਪ ਕੰਨਿਆ ਸੁੰਦਰਿ ਬੇਧੀ ਸਸੈ ਸਿੰਘ ਗੁਨ ਗਾਏ ॥੩॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He marries a beautiful and enticing young woman; the rabbit and the lion sing their praises. ||3||

transliteration.text: rūp kanniā sundar bēdhī sasai singh gun gāē .3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਕਹਤ ਕਬੀਰ ਸੁਨਹੁ ਰੇ ਸੰਤਹੁ ਕੀਟੀ ਪਰਬਤੁ ਖਾਇਆ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, listen, O Saints - the ant has eaten the mountain.

transliteration.text: kahat kabīr sunah rē santah kītī parabat khāiā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The turtle says, "I need a burning coal, also." Listen to this mystery of the Shabad. ||4||6||

transliteration.text: kashūā kahai angār bh lōrau lūkī sabad sunāiā .4.6.

text: ਬਟੂਆ ਏਕੁ ਬਹਤਰਿ ਆਧਾਰੀ ਏਕੋ ਜਿਸਹਿ ਦੁਆਰਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The body is a bag with seventy-two chambers, and one opening, the Tenth Gate.

transliteration.text: batūā ēk bahatar ādhārī ēkō jisah duārā .

text: ਨਵੈ ਖੰਡ ਕੀ ਪ੍ਰਿਥਮੀ ਮਾਗੈ ਸੋ ਜੋਗੀ ਜਗਿ ਸਾਰਾ ॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He alone is a real Yogi on this earth, who asks for the primal world of the nine regions. ||1||

transliteration.text: navai khand kī prithamī māgai sō jōgī jag sārā .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਐਸਾ ਜੋਗੀ ਨਉ ਨਿਧਿ ਪਾਵੈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Such a Yogi obtains the nine treasures.

transliteration.text: aisā jōgī nau nidh pāvai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਤਲ ਕਾ ਬ੍ਰਹਮੁ ਲੇ ਗਗਨਿ ਚਰਾਵੈ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He lifts his soul up from below, to the skies of the Tenth Gate. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: tal kā braham lē gagan charāvai .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਖਿੰਥਾ ਗਿਆਨ ਧਿਆਨ ਕਰਿ ਸੂਈ ਸਬਦੁ ਤਾਗਾ ਮਥਿ ਘਾਲੈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He makes spiritual wisdom his patched coat, and meditation his needle. He twists the thread of the Word of the Shabad.

transliteration.text: khinthā giān dhiān kar sūī sabad tāgā math ghālai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਪੰਚ ਤਤੁ ਕੀ ਕਰਿ ਮਿਰਗਾਣੀ ਗੁਰ ਕੈ ਮਾਰਗਿ ਚਾਲੈ ॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Making the five elements his deer skin to sit on, he walks on the Guru's Path. ||2||

transliteration.text: panch tat kī kar miragānī gur kai mārag chālai .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਦਇਆ ਫਾਹੁਰੀ ਕਾਇਆ ਕਰਿ ਧੂਈ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਕੀ ਅਗਨਿ ਜਲਾਵੈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He makes compassion his shovel, his body the firewood, and he kindles the fire of divine vision.

transliteration.text: daiā phāhurī kāiā kar dhūī drisat kī agan jalāvai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਤਿਸ ਕਾ ਭਾਉ ਲਏ ਰਿਦ ਅੰਤਰਿ ਚਹੁ ਜੁਗ ਤਾੜੀ ਲਾਵੈ ॥੩॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He places love within his heart, and he remains in deep meditation throughout the four ages. ||3||

transliteration.text: tis kā bhāu laē rid antar chah jug tārī lāvai .3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਸਭ ਜੋਗਤਣ ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮੁ ਹੈ ਜਿਸ ਕਾ ਪਿੰਡੁ ਪਰਾਨਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: All Yoga is in the Name of the Lord; the body and the breath of life belong to Him.

transliteration.text: sabh jōgatan rām nām hai jis kā pind parānā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੇ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਧਾਰੈ ਦੇਇ ਸਚਾ ਨੀਸਾਨਾ ॥੪॥੭॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, if God grants His Grace, He bestows the insignia of Truth. ||4||7||

transliteration.text: kah kabīr jē kirapā dhārai dēi sachā nīsānā .4.7.

text: ਆਸਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Aasaa:

transliteration.text: āsā .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਹਿੰਦੂ ਤੁਰਕ ਕਹਾ ਤੇ ਆਏ ਕਿਨਿ ਏਹ ਰਾਹ ਚਲਾਈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Where have the Hindus and Muslims come from? Who put them on their different paths?

transliteration.text: hindū turak kahā tē āē kin ēh rāh chalāī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਦਿਲ ਮਹਿ ਸੋਚਿ ਬਿਚਾਰਿ ਕਵਾਦੇ ਭਿਸਤ ਦੋਜਕ ਕਿਨਿ ਪਾਈ ॥੧॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Think of this, and contemplate it within your mind, O men of evil intentions. Who will go to heaven and hell? ||1||

transliteration.text: dil mah sōch bichār kavādē bhisat dōjak kin pāī .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਕਾਜੀ ਤੈ ਕਵਨ ਕਤੇਬ ਬਖਾਨੀ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Qazi, which book have you read?

transliteration.text: kājī tai kavan katēb bakhānī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਪੜ੍ਹਤ ਗੁਨਤ ਐਸੇ ਸਭ ਮਾਰੇ ਕਿਨਹੂੰ ਖਬਰਿ ਨ ਜਾਨੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Such scholars and students have all died, and none of them have discovered the inner meaning. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: parhat gunat aisē sabh mārē kinahūn khabar n jānī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਸਕਤਿ ਸਨੇਹੁ ਕਰਿ ਸੁੰਨਤਿ ਕਰੀਐ ਮੈ ਨ ਬਦਉਗਾ ਭਾਈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Because of the love of woman, circumcision is done; I don't believe in it, O Siblings of Destiny.

transliteration.text: sakat sanēh kar sunnat karīai mai n badaugā bhāī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਜਉ ਰੇ ਖੁਦਾਇ ਮੋਹਿ ਤੁਰਕੁ ਕਰੈਗਾ ਆਪਨ ਹੀ ਕਟਿ ਜਾਈ ॥੨॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If God wished me to be a Muslim, it would be cut off by itself. ||2||

transliteration.text: jau rē khudāi mōh turak karaigā āpan hī kat jāī .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. text: ਸੁੰਨਤਿ ਕੀਏ ਤੁਰਕੁ ਜੇ ਹੋਇਗਾ ਅਉਰਤ ਕਾ ਕਿਆ ਕਰੀਐ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If circumcision makes one a Muslim, then what about a woman?

transliteration.text: sunnat kīē turak jē hōigā aurat kā kiā karīai .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਅਰਧ ਸਰੀਰੀ ਨਾਰਿ ਨ ਛੋਡੈ ਤਾ ਤੇ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਹੀ ਰਹੀਐ ॥੩॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: She is the other half of a man's body, and she does not leave him, so he remains a Hindu. ||3||

transliteration.text: aradh sarīrī nār n shōdai tā tē hindū hī rahīai .3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਛਾਡਿ ਕਤੇਬ ਰਾਮੁ ਭਜੁ ਬਉਰੇ ਜੁਲਮ ਕਰਤ ਹੈ ਭਾਰੀ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Give up your holy books, and remember the Lord, you fool, and stop oppressing others so badly.

transliteration.text: shād katēb rām bhaj baurē julam karat hai bhārī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਕਬੀਰੈ ਪਕਰੀ ਟੇਕ ਰਾਮ ਕੀ ਤੁਰਕ ਰਹੇ ਪਚਿਹਾਰੀ ॥੪॥੮॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Kabeer has grasped hold of the Lord's Support, and the Muslims have utterly failed. ||4||8||

transliteration.text: kabīrai pakarī tēk rām kī turak rahē pachihārī .4.8.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਆਸਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Aasaa:

transliteration.text: āsā .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਜਬ ਲਗੁ ਤੇਲੁ ਦੀਵੇ ਮੁਖਿ ਬਾਤੀ ਤਬ ਸੂਝੈ ਸਭੁ ਕੋਈ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: As long as the oil and the wick are in the lamp, everything is illuminated.

transliteration.text: jab lag tēl dīvē mukh bātī tab sūjhai sabh kōī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.
